channel.title: Can some ppl knowledgable about SCAR help?
channel.description:
I'm making a human like script for Destruct-o-Match II on Neopets. I have the basic script finished, but I need some people to test and if you know SCAR try to tell me what I need to do to fix it. This is only my second script so...it might be evident of that. No one steal the script ok Copyright 2006-2007 This material belongs to snuwoods
-- snuwoods

item.title: Can some ppl knowledgable about SCAR help?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

You mean this?

if(getcolor(x,y)=39423)then begin MoveMouseSmooth(x+random(1),y+random(2)); GetMousePos(x,y); MyClickMouse(x,y,true); end else begin // n:=(n+1); x:=(x-60) y:=(y+60) getcolor(x,y) if(getcolor(x,y)=39423)then
That is because the else statement is like an if statement, and it will only excecute one thing after it. But if I put a begin, it will excecute everything after it, until I hit the end; part of that statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Can some ppl knowledgable about SCAR help?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

If your statements with the MouseMovement pattarns have more thaan one thing they are asked to do, you must have a begin… end.

I will give you an example:
Bad Code:

var FX,FY : integer; begin FX:=325; FY:=56; if (GetColor(FX,FY) = 53324) then MoveMouseSmooth(FX,FY); //Would only excecute one statement after it, therefor Clicking the mouse, even if the color isn't found. ClickMouse(FX,FY); end;

Good Code:

var FX,FY : integer; begin FX:=325; FY:=56; if (GetColor(FX,FY) = 53324) then begin MoveMouseSmooth(FX,FY); //Excecute both, because the if statement tells the begin to start, and inside the begin it asks to move, and click the mouse. ClickMouse(FX,FY); end; end;

The spacing is called standards. They are not required, but they make your code look cleaner and more readable. If you want to learn perfect standards, look at some of the Kaitnieks examples that came with SCAR, and watch where the spacing is done.

Read full topic
item.source: Can some ppl knowledgable about SCAR help?

Thanks

snuwoods [br][size=1]Posted at: July 17, 2006, 08:56:29 PM[/size][hr]Do I have to add Begin and End to all of the sections like movemousesmooth, getmousepos, and myclickmouse? And is there a “rule” for neat coding (I noticed that you and most other scripts I see have 2 spaces or more and the code kinda forms waves on the right side)?

Thanks

snuwoods

@Cheesehunk wrote:

Hmm, I don’t play nepoets, so I don’t know why it would do that, sorry.

Maybe in your findcolor procedures you need a mouseclick after it. You just have FindColor(…)
Do you mean to have if FindColor(…) then ClickMouse(…) Etc, etc.

item.title: Can some ppl knowledgable about SCAR help?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Hmm, I’m not sure how neopets detection system works, but if it is a bit more advanced I would suggest using MoveMouseSmooth, or an even better mouse procedure. Then use getpousepos to find your current mouse position, then use something like Holdmouse, and ReleaseMouse to make the clicking more human.

Also, I suggest making your waits, and clicks a little more random. :rolleyes:

Hereis an example from your script, that I also added standards to:

[code]var
x,y,n:integer;

const
tolerance=6;

procedure MyClickMouse(x,y:integer,left:boolean);
begin
HoldMouse(x,y,left);
wait(25+random(40));
ReleaseMouse(x,y,left);
end;

Procedure Start;
begin
ActivateClient;
MoveMouseSmooth(180+random(2),581+random(2));
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
wait(200+random(200))
MoveMouseSmooth(444+random(2),528+random(2));
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
Wait(150+random(200));
MoveMouseSmooth(315+random(2),298+random(2););
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
end;

Procedure Orange;
begin
findcolor(x,y,39423,16,147,615,508);
end;

Procedure OLSide;
begin
x:=(x+60)
getcolor(x,y);
if(getcolor(x,y)=39423)then
begin
MoveMouseSmooth(x+random(1),y+random(2));
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
end else
begin
n:=(n+1);
x:=(x-60)
y:=(y+60)
getcolor(x,y)
if(getcolor(x,y)=39423)then
begin
MoveMouseSmooth(x+random(1),y+random(2));
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
end else
begin
n:=(n+1);
y:=(y-120)
getcolor(x,y)
if(getcolor(x,y)=39423)then
begin
MoveMouseSmooth(x+random(1),y+random(2));
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
end else
n:=(n+1);
if(n=3)then
orange;
end;
end;
end;

Procedure ONLSide;
begin
x:=(x+60)
getcolor(x,y)
if(getcolor(x,y)=39423)then
begin
MoveMouseSmooth(x+random(1),y+random(2));
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
end else
n:=(n+1);
x:=(x-120)
getcolor(x,y)
if(getcolor(x,y)=39423)then
begin
MoveMouseSmooth(x+random(1),y+random(2));
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
end else
n:=(n+1);
x:=(x+60)
y:=(y+40)
getcolor(x,y)
if(getcolor(x,y)=39423)then
begin
MoveMouseSmooth(x+random(1),y+random(2));
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
end else
n:=(n+1);
y:=(y-80)
getcolor(x,y)
if(getcolor(x,y)=39423)then
begin
MoveMouseSmooth(x+random(1),y+random(2));
GetMousePos(x,y);
MyClickMouse(x,y,true);
end else
n:=(n+1);
if(n=4)then
orange;
end;

Procedure Blue;
begin
findcolor(x,y,16686176,16,147,615,508);
end;[/code]
Good job for a second script by the way, any more questions you got? Hit me up on MSN: cheesehunk@hotmail.com Or post 'em here.

Read full topic
